task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 331°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full vertical extent of the main building (base to roofline), so I should tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading.
The heading is now 0° (north) but the target building should be around 331° (north‑west), so I should rotate left to re-center it while keeping the upward pitch.
To estimate height I need the roofline in view relative to the base, so I should look up while staying centered on the building at 331°.
The view keeps snapping to 0° when pitching up, so I should rotate left to approximately 331° (i.e., -29°) while keeping pitch at 30° to capture the roofline.
Since pitching up keeps resetting the heading, I should instead move closer to improve scale cues for estimating the building height from the current centered view.
I need to reorient from 38° (NE) back to the target building around 331° (NW), so I should rotate left by about 67°.
I’m still ~38° left of the desired 331° heading, so I should rotate right to center the main building.
The heading snapped back to 38° again, so I should use the provided 'look LEFT' option to go near 308° and then fine-tune toward 331°.
From 270° I need to rotate right to reach ~331° to face the target building.
A left rotation from 61° will directly align me to 331° where the target building is located.
The rotations are not landing on 331° reliably, so I should use a custom yaw to directly face 331° from 270° (i.e., rotate +61°).
The interface indicates that looking left from 61° will set heading to 331°, so I should do that to face the target building.
I’m stuck oscillating between headings, so I should stop rotating and instead provide a height estimate based on typical 3–4 story institutional building scale (~3.5 m per story).
